intro: Secamone pachystigma, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy berries. Its roots and stems are used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The botanical features of Secamone pachystigma make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ethnobotanical studies.
